Authors: Ulrich Meve, A. Tuber, Sigrid Liede
Title:
What is the subtribe Glossonematinae (Apocynaceae:
Asclepiadoideae)? A phylogenetic analysis based on cpDNA spacer.
Journal: Botanical Journal of the Linnean Society
Keywords:
Asclepiadeae; classification; DNA-sequences; karyology;
morphology; trnT-L spacer; trnL intron; trnL-F spacer
Abstract:
Evidence from the chloroplast trnT-L spacer, trnL intron
and trnL-F spacer shows the subtribe Glossonematinae of the tribe
Asclepiadeae, hitherto composed of the Arabian and North African genera
Glossonema, Odontanthera and Solenostemma, to be non-monoyphyletic.
While the affinities of Solenostemma cannot be determined with certainty
at present, molecular, karyological and morphological evidence suggests
that Glossonema and Odontanthera are closely allied to Pentarrhinum, an
African genus of five species, belonging to the Cynanchinae.
